title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Wednesday, 13 April 2016 - BBC News
summary: spate of violence at the mcdonald 's in luton town centre has led police to call for the restaurant to lose its late-night licence .
woman , 93 , tricked into handing over £ 5,000 after a scam phone call in stevenage .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage throughout the day
text: that 's it for today from the team at local live for beds , herts and bucks .
we 'll be back on thursday morning from 08:00 with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .

documents.title: woman raped in milton keynes in open grass area
text: house-to-house inquiries are taking place in milton keynes after a woman was raped on 4 april .
the woman in her 30s came forward yesterday .
she had been walking in conniburrow boulevard from bradwell common towards downs barn at about 04:00 .
she walked through an alleyway near a park off yarrow place when she noticed a man following her .
he then assaulted and raped her in the open grassed area between the houses located between yarrow place , conniburrow boulevard and ramsons avenue before fleeing .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: one-punch death accused 'meant no harm '
text: a luton civil engineer accused of killing a man with a single punch believed he was about to be `` hit first '' , a court has heard .
amazon employee tomas juska was hit with an upper-cut punch outside cookies nightclub in dunstable by cortney batchelor , luton crown court heard .
the 24-year-old suffered a lethal brain injury and died the next day .
mr batchelor , 22 , of paisley close , luton , denies manslaughter , claiming he had acted in self defence after he was confronted by mr juska .
the case continues .
author: Laurence Cawley
BBC News

documents.title: tipper truck seized during fly-tipping arrests is crushed
text: an unregistered tipper truck has been crushed today after it was seized by hertsmere borough council .
the vehicle became the property of the council last month after its occupants were arrested in bushey on sus of fly-tipping offences .
they were bailed by police whilst the council continues its investigation into a number of alleged offences .

documents.title: headlines : police investigating after a woman is raped in milton keynes unregistered tipper truck is crushed
text: here are the main stories making the news this evening :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather : showers easing overnight
text: there may be the odd shower this evening and overnight , but these will mostly die out to leave fairly cloudy skies and light winds .
there may be the odd patch of mist or fog but this will mostly be confined to sheltered spots such as in marston vale .
minimum temperature : 6c ( 43f ) .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: teenager in serious condition after being hit by a bus
text: a 15-year-old girl is in a serous but stable condition after being hit by a bus in high wycombe this morning .
the girl was taken to john radcliffe hospital in oxford with a head injury after being hit by the single decker bus in marlow hill , opposite wycombe high school , at 08:00 .

pc chris fallon said : `` i would like to speak to anyone who witnessed the incident who has not yet contacted police , or anyone who saw the bus or the pedestrian prior to the collision taking place . ''
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lottery grant submitted to expand bucks county museum
text: an application to get £ 5m worth of lottery money has been submitted by the trustees of the bucks county museum in aylesbury .
they hope to embark on a major expansion project that will see the display area doubled as well as increasing the cafe , shop and community spaces .
the bid will be supplemented by £ 1m worth of local fundraising and grants .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man jailed for five years for possessing handgun
text: a luton man has been jailed for possessing a handgun after it was found by two workmen .
they 'd come to fix a boiler at dewsbury road last month and discovered a bag containing a gun and silencer , so called police .
detectives later found dna matching that of david cooper , who lived there .
the 51-year-old was given a five-year prison sentence after admitting possessing a firearm without a licence at luton crown court .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: high wycombe demonstrators released on police bail
text: four people arrested during demonstrations in high wycombe on saturday have been released on police bail .
a 21-year-old man from brighton was arrested on sus of criminal damage .
two 17-year-old boys and an 18-year-old man , all from high wycombe , were arrested on sus of public order offences .
the arrests came at a planned demonstration by the english defence league and counter protests in wycombe .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fence built on ashridge estate to protect bluebells
text: a fence has been put up on the national trust 's ashridge estate after it was announced a charge is to be introduced for people to see the bluebells during the next bank holiday .
the charity says the fence is needed to protect the woodbank and ditch , which is being eroded in several places .
it will also reduce the amount of damage to the bluebells .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: easter egg surprise beamed around the world
text: a newly updated webcam on the highest tower block in aylesbury is currently broadcasting an easter egg surprise .
a peregrine falcon has laid four eggs which is the largest clutch of eggs these breeding pairs have ever produced .
the camera is part of the aylesbury peregrine project and people have viewed the images from afar afield as japan and australia .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : sunny spells but with showers later
text: it will turn cloudier through this afternoon , with scattered showers developing , perhaps turning heavy and thundery .
feeling pleasantly warm in the light winds and spring sunshine .
maximum temperature : 16c ( 61f ) .
thanks to weather watcher michelle in bucks for the photo of chalfont st giles .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : milton keynes national badminton centre set for expansion luton man jailed after workmen find an illegal handgun on top of boiler
text: here are the main stories making the news this afternoon :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: land worth millions being given to mk 's national badminton centre
text: £ 3.5m worth of land is being given to the national badminton centre in loughton from milton keynes council .
the land is to be used to expand and redevelop its existing facilities after a deal to relocate the centre to the national bowl fell through .
the land must be used for development of national , amateur and competitive sport and not turned into a commercial leisure centre , according to restrictions placed on the deal .
the council says it wants to support `` major and ambitious projects '' in the town , and that it 's in keeping with its desire to be seen as an international sporting city .
author: Paul Scoins
BBC Three Counties Radio political reporter

documents.title: house cordoned off after 'unknown substance ' found
text: a cordon has been put in place at a property in baldock after reports of an unknown substance being found in the loft .
hertfordshire police said it was called to london road at about 11:10 and put the cordon in place `` as a precaution '' .
a spokeswoman says tests will be carried out to establish what the substance is .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tesco boss says 'better service ' is behind company 's return to profit
text: tesco chief executive dave lewis says the company has `` regained competitiveness in the uk '' .
it comes after the hertfordshire-based company announced a pre-tax profit of £ 162m for the past year - compared to a £ 6.4bn loss a year ago .
mr lewis said : `` our balance sheet is stronger and we are making good progress in rebuilding trust in tesco and our investment case . ''
author: Richard Bond
BBC Look East business correspondent

documents.title: aylesbury derby postponed again
text: the derby between aylesbury fc and aylesbury united was postponed for a fifth time last night .
the game , dubbed the `` el quackico '' derby as aylesbury united are nicknamed the ducks , was called off due to a waterlogged pitch .
that 's the fourth weather postponement - the other time was due to a half-time floodlight failure last month .
the fixture has been rescheduled for thursday evening , with a 19:45 kick-off at haywood way .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: the day joe payne scored 10 goals for luton
text: eighty years ago today luton legend joe payne made history by scoring 10 goals in one game against bristol rovers .
the match at kenilworth road was his debut as a centre-forward .
it ended luton 12-0 bristol rovers .
payne 's achievement has yet to be matched .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tickets for speeding motorists handed out in chesham
text: a road safety day is taking place in chesham today :
road safety day in # chesham .
tickets for speeding , seat belts , defective vehicles .
great feedback .
# drivesafely .

documents.title: warm day across beds , herts and bucks
text: today the three counties are set to experience highs of 16c .
so to mark this gorgeous day here are some fantastic photos sent in by our weather watchers .
you can send us your photos direct by email or twitter .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'i played on with a broken arm '
text: sport columnist and wycombe wanderers midfielder matt bloomfield has revealed he played for several minutes with a broken arm after scoring at york on saturday .
the break happened just after he headed the ball into the goal , as a york defender connected with his arm .
he said he had to play on through the pain because the team had used all its substitutes .
`` there was no way that i was going to leave my team-mates with 10 men whilst i was still able to run so i just had to grit my teeth and get on with it , '' he said .
author: Matt Bloomfield
BBC Sport columnist

documents.title: cannabis found in hertfordshire house
text: police discovered around £ 70,000 worth of cannabis after raiding a house in markyate , hertfordshire , last night .
hertfordshire police says it was alerted by a member of the public to the large cannabis factory at the close .
one man has been arrested .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: luton town 's former manager gets standing ovation as hatters get the win
text: luton town managed a 1-0 win over former manager john still 's dagenham at kenilworth road last night .
still ( given a standing ovation on his first return since being sacked in december .
current manager nathan jones said the applause was `` fully deserved '' .
he said : `` [ we had ] a cup of tea before the game and it was good to speak to him because he 's a good man and he 's done well for [ this ] club .
i 've known john for years and i wish him all the best . ''
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: arrests made after armed police raid in luton
text: armed police were called to a house in luton yesterday evening , following reports that a firearm had been seen .
no firearms were recovered , but a search of the property in biscot road at about 17:00 revealed a large quantity of cannabis plants .
six people were arrested .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teenager hurt after collision with bus in high wycombe
text: thames valley police has confirmed that a teenage girl was involved in a collision with a bus in marlow hill in high wycombe at just after 08:00 this morning .
the girl was taken to john radcliffe hospital .
the road is about to reopen but there are traffic delays across the town centre .
motorists are being advised to avoid the area .
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: tesco returns to profit as uk sales grow
text: tesco has announced a pre-tax profit of £ 162m for last year - compared to a £ 6.4bn loss a year ago .
new boss dave lewis has made a number of changes including plans to move its main headquarters from cheshunt to welwyn garden city , in a measure expected to save £ 250m .
he said : `` our balance sheet is stronger and we are making good progress in rebuilding trust in tesco and our investment case . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel news : marlow hill about to re-open after earlier accident
text: there 's very slow traffic on the a40 in high wycombe at the a404 marlow hill junction after an earlier accident .
the road is about to reopen .
on scene at collision in @ twitterid - marlow hill closed towards handycross .
avoid the area .
updates to follow .
marlow hill rtc scene has now been cleared.road is about to reopen.closure necessary for care to patient & investigation .
still delays # p5996

documents.title: police release footage of dangerous motorcyclist
text: footage has been released of a police pursuit of a dangerous motorcyclist who was sentenced to eight months in jail last week .
akeem foster , 24 , of teesdale , luton , was sentenced at luton crown court after being found guilty of dangerous driving .
he was arrested in sundon park in february , following a pursuit in luton that lasted almost two hours and involved the police helicopter .

he was caught riding an off-road motorcycle through the town without a helmet , often travelling on the wrong side of the road and the wrong way around roundabouts , as well as carrying out stunts such as wheelies .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: phone scam warning after 93-year-old woman conned in stevenage
text: a 93-year-old woman has been tricked into handing over £ 5,000 , after a scam phone call in stevenage on monday afternoon .
hertfordshire police says there have been eight incidents in the town in the past month , four of which have resulted in money totalling nearly £ 25,000 being handed over .
officers say a female caller has claimed to be a detective from hammersmith police station , where they have detained two males in possession of the victim 's bank cards .
the caller asks the victims to go to their bank , withdraw money and hand it to a courier .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: travel : crash on a412
text: the a412 watford road in croxley green is partially blocked between the new road junction and the hazelwood road junction due to a crash .
get the latest updates from bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: police call for luton mcdonald 's to lose late-night licence
text: a spate of violence at the mcdonald 's in luton town centre has led bedfordshire police to ask luton borough council to revoke its licence to open through the night .
violent offences are up by more than 60 % year-on-year , with more than 46 incidents reported .
a doorman was arrested on sus of assault and then charged with carrying a knife .
the restaurant says it 's dismissed the staff involved and is working with the local authorities to tackle anti-social behaviour .
councillors contacted by bbc three counties radio have said they did not want to comment until a decision had been made .
author: Paul Scoins
BBC Three Counties Radio political reporter

documents.title: today 's weather : sunny spells , showers later
text: today will see sunny spells this morning , with showers developing this afternoon which might turn heavy and thundery .
maximum temperature : 16c ( 60f ) .
get the detailed forecast where you live from bbc weather .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: latest headlines : police call for mcdonalds to lose late-night licence woman , 93 , tricked out of £ 5k in phone scam
text: here are the top stories we 're looking at this morning :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: welcome to the live page for beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to today 's live page for the three counties , where we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel until 18:00 .
coming up , we 'll bring you news of a police bid for mcdonalds in luton town centre to lose its late-night licence and phone scams in stevenage .
you can get in touch via twitter or send us an email .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live
